newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: World Bank approves $213 mln loan for Bangladesh.
newsitem.headline: World Bank approves $213 mln loan for Bangladesh.

text.p: The World Bank will offer Bangladesh credits worth $213.3 million for two development projects, a bank statement said.
The bank will provide $133 million to finance development of road communications in rural areas, the statement released on Saturday said.
The second loan worth $80.3 million will be spent on setting up water treatment plants in the capital Dhaka.
Both credits, approved by the Washington-based bank on Friday, will be channelled through the International Development Association (IDA), its concessionary lending arm.
